pr_title: GG-31173: ODBC nullability info for columns

timeline.message: GG-31173: Server provides nullability info for columns
GG-31173: Implement ODBC Driver part. Fix tests

timeline.bodyText:
Using int for nullability is very confusing, especially if you don't know about ResultSetMetaData. Can we make this boolean, since columnNullableUnknown is not used and there are only 2 possible values? Here and below.
Should we add a property instead of making the field public?
timeline.author: ptupitsyn

replies.bodyText:
I'm not sure that columnNullableUnknown is not used and can never be returned. Do you propose to use some kind of enum here? Or should I add a comment?
You are right. I'm not sure, why this and other fields are public. Will change.
replies.author: isapego

replies.bodyText:
This field is initialized only in one place in OdbcRequestHandler: prop.notNull() ? columnNoNulls : columnNullable.
columnNullableUnknown is never used if I'm not missing anything.
replies.author: ptupitsyn

replies.bodyText: That's not the only place where nullability is taken from - see second constructor, it takes nullability from H2 result set column information.
replies.author: isapego

replies.bodyText: Ok then, let's keep it as is, but add a comment with a reference to ResultSetMetaData to indicate the meaning.
replies.author: ptupitsyn

replies.bodyText: Added comment that I hope will make it more clear.
replies.author: isapego
